TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ConfigurationElementCollection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable
Public MustInherit Class ConfigurationElementCollection Inherits ConfigurationElement Implements ICollection
public ref class ConfigurationElementCollection abstract : System::Configuration::ConfigurationElement, System::Collections::ICollection

summary.span: 表示一个配置元素，该元素包含子元素的集合。

span.span: Represents a configuration element containing a collection of child elements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 表示配置文件中的元素的集合。The represents a collection of elements within a configuration file. > [!NOTE] > 配置文件中的元素是指基本的 XML 元素或部分。An element within a configuration file refers to a basic XML element or a section. 如果有的话，简单元素将是具有相关属性的 XML 标记。A simple element is an XML tag with related attributes, if any. 简单元素构成部分。A simple element constitutes a section. 复杂部分可以包含一个或多个简单的元素、 元素的集合和其他部分。Complex sections can contain one or more simple elements, a collection of elements, and other sections. 你使用要使用的集合对象。You use the to work with a collection of objects. 实现此类，以添加自定义集合元素与。Implement this class to add collections of custom elements to a . ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用。The following example shows how to use the . 第一个示例由三个类组成： `UrlsSection`，`UrlsCollection`和`UrlConfigElement`。`UrlsSection`类使用来定义自定义配置节。The first example consists of three classes: `UrlsSection`, `UrlsCollection` and `UrlConfigElement`.The `UrlsSection` class uses the to define a custom configuration section. 此节包含一个 URL 集合 (由定义`UrlsCollection`类) 的 URL 元素 (由定义`UrlConfigElement`类)。This section contains a URL collection (defined by the `UrlsCollection` class) of URL elements (defined by the `UrlConfigElement` class). [!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.configuration.configurationelementcollection/cs/customcollectionsection.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.configuration.configurationelementcollection/vb/customcollectionsection.vb#1)] 此第二个代码示例使用之前指定的类。This second code example uses the classes specified before. 合并的控制台应用程序项目中的以下两个示例。You combine these two examples in a console application project. [!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection#31](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.configuration.configurationelementcollection/cs/usingconfigurationcollectionelement.cs#31)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection#31](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.configuration.configurationelementcollection/vb/usingconfigurationcollectionelement.vb#31)] 当你运行控制台应用程序的实例`UrlsSection`创建类并在应用程序配置文件中生成以下配置元素：When you run the console application, an instance of the `UrlsSection` class is created and the following configuration elements are generated in the application configuration file: ```

para.span: 可用于以编程方式或声明性 （特性化） 编码模型创建自定义配置元素。

span.span: You can use a programmatic or a declarative (attributed) coding model to create a custom configuration element.

para.span: 编程模型要求为每个元素属性创建一个属性以获取并设置其值，并添加到基础的内部属性包基类。

span.span: The programmatic model requires that for each element attribute you create a property to get and set its value, and that you add it to the internal property bag of the underlying base class.

para.span: 声明性模型，也称为特性化的模型中，允许你通过使用属性并将其配置具有属性定义元素属性。

span.span: The declarative model, also referred to as the attributed model, allows you to define an element attribute by using a property and configuring it with attributes.

para.span: 这些属性指示 ASP.NET 配置系统有关属性类型和其默认值。

span.span: These attributes instruct the ASP.NET configuration system about the property types and their default values.

para.span: ASP.NET 可以使用反射来获取此信息并随后创建属性对象的元素，并执行所需的初始化。

span.span: ASP.NET can use reflection to obtain this information and then create the element property objects and perform the required initialization.

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 用于设置要使用比较器。The is used to set a comparer to use. 例如，不区分大小写的比较器可用于使密钥区分大小写。For example, you can use a case-insensitive comparer to make the key case insensitive.

summary.span: 在派生的类中重写时，获取或设置 的名称，以便在 中与添加操作关联。

The name of the element.

span.span: The selected value starts with the reserved prefix "config" or "lock".

summary.span: 在派生的类中重写时，向 实例添加 。

span.span: Adds a to an instance when overridden in a derived class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法添加新到集合。Use the method to add a new to the collection. 在派生类中重写，如果该元素已添加所需自定义行为。Override in a derived class if custom behavior is required when the element is added. 添加元素时，只有键相同而值不同的元素才被视为重复元素。When adding, an element is considered a duplicate only if the keys are identical but the values are different. 键和值都相同的元素将被接受并且不给出提示，原因是这些元素不会相互竞争。Elements with identical keys and values are accepted silently because the elements do not compete. 但是，无法添加键相同而值不同的元素，因为无法从逻辑上确定哪个竞争值有效。However, an element with an identical key but a different value cannot be added because there is no logic to determine which of the competing values should be honored.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 重写方法来创建自定义特定类型的对象。Override the method to create custom objects of a specific type. 当从配置文件中，加载一个集合调用创建各个元素。When a collection is loaded from the configuration file, is called to create individual elements. 必须在从派生类中重写类。 must be overridden in classes that derive from the class.

block.para:
如果创建自定义集合，其中包含异类类型，必须执行以下步骤：If you create a custom collection that contains heterogeneous types, you must perform these steps:
- 重写 方法。Override the method.
- 请确保方法返回一个字符串，标识通过调用创建的元素的类型方法。Make sure that the method returns a string that identifies the type of the element you created by calling the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果在添加一个重复的元素时，引发异常元素的值可以是或。When you add a duplicate element, an exception is thrown if the value of the element is either or . 请注意，使用相同键和值的元素不被视为重复项，并且以静默方式接受。Note that elements with identical keys and values are not considered duplicates, and are accepted silently. 具有相同的密钥，但不同的值的唯一元素将被视为重复项。Only elements with identical keys but different values are considered duplicates. 有关详细信息，请参阅备注部分方法。For more information, see the Remarks section for the method.

span.span: The parent object of the current element, or if this is the top level.

summary.span: 反转将配置层次结构的不同级别配置的信息合并在一起的效果

span.span: Reverses the effect of merging configuration information from different levels of the configuration hierarchy

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法可反转从配置层次结构的不同级别合并配置信息的效果。The method reverses the effect of merging configuration information from different levels of the configuration hierarchy. 这将允许在序列化之前，当前层次结构级别上的配置设置与父级别上的配置设置有所不同。This allows configuration set at the current hierarchy level to be differentiated from that set at parent levels, before serialization. 由新的临时元素来比较父对象和源对象上的系统调用。 is called by the system on a new temporary element to compare the parent object and the source object. 基于值，它然后设置要包含需要进行序列化的数据的临时对象。Based on the value, it then sets the temporary object to contain the data that needs to be serialized. 有关保存模式的详细信息，请参阅。For details about save modes, see .
